perturbation.original_text: As promptly as practicable, but in no event later than two business days following the execution of this Agreement, the Nominating Committee and the Board shall take all necessary action to (i) increase the size of the Board from eight to nine directors, with such new Board seat to be in Class III, (ii) appoint the New Director as a Class III director on the Board and (iii) appoint the New Director to the Nominating Committee.
perturbation.changed_text: The Nominating Committee and the Board shall take all necessary action within five business days following the execution of this Agreement to (i) increase the size of the Board from eight to nine directors, with such new Board seat to be in Class III, (ii) appoint the New Director as a Class III director on the Board and (iii) appoint the New Director to the Nominating Committee.
perturbation.explanation: Delaying the appointment of the New Director to five business days may impede their timely participation in key decisions and contradicts the clause stating 'As promptly as practicable'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Fiduciary Duty under Delaware Law

perturbation.original_text: The Marathon Parties shall provide written evidence of such vote to the Company no later than ten (10) business days prior to the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.changed_text: The Marathon Parties shall provide written evidence of such vote to the Company no later than two (2) business days prior to the 2020 Annual Meeting.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the time frame for providing evidence of vote to two business days before the meeting limits the company's ability to verify the vote and potentially respond to any discrepancies, potentially conflicting with the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing under Delaware Law

perturbation.original_text: (h) Reimbursement. The Company shall reimburse the Marathon Parties for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel, incurred in connection with their engagement with the Company, the Nominations and the negotiation of, and all matters arising under this Agreement; provided, however, that such reimbursement shall not exceed $250,000.
perturbation.changed_text: (h) Reimbursement. The Company will reimburse the Marathon Parties for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses, including the reasonable fees and expenses of counsel, incurred related to their engagement with the Company, the Nominations, and the negotiation of and all matters stemming from this Agreement, but the reimbursement will be given only if the agreement conditions, as the company sees fit, are met and the amount will not exceed $100,000.
perturbation.explanation: Altering the reimbursement conditions and lowering the reimbursement amount without any prior notice infringes on the principle of reasonableness and good faith. This perturbation will lead the Marathon Parties to be concerned about their compensations and rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Good Faith and Fair Dealing under Delaware Law
